full_history.content: How do I calculate reduced live load using Equation 16-7 for an office building with interior beams, each supporting a tributary area of 500 square feet?

Given Data:
- A<sub>T</sub> = 500 sq ft (tributary area)
- K<sub>LL</sub> = 2 (live load element factor for interior beams - Table 1607.12.1)
- L<sub>o</sub> = 50 psf (unreduced live load for office buildings - Table 1607.1)

Equation 16-7 (IBC 1607.12.1): L = L<sub>o</sub>(0.25 + 15/√(K<sub>LL</sub> × A<sub>T</sub>))

Step-by-step calculation:
1. Calculate K<sub>LL</sub> × A<sub>T</sub> = 2 × 500 = 1000 sq ft
2. Calculate √(K<sub>LL</sub> × A<sub>T</sub>) = √1000 = 31.62
3. Calculate 15/√(K<sub>LL</sub> × A<sub>T</sub>) = 15/31.62 = 0.474
4. Calculate (0.25 + 0.474) = 0.724
5. Calculate L = 50 psf × 0.724 = 36.2 psf

Verification (IBC 1607.12.1):
- Minimum allowed for members supporting one floor: 0.50 × L<sub>o</sub> = 0.50 × 50 psf = 25 psf
- Calculated value: 36.2 psf > 25 psf ✓ COMPLIANT

Final Answer: The reduced design live load (L) for the interior beams is 36.2 psf.
